metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7777 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Xen 4.7.x and earlier does not properly honor CR0.TS and CR0.EM, whichallows local x86 HVM guest OS users to read or modify FPU, MMX, or XMMregister state information belonging to arbitrary tasks on the guest bymodifying an instruction while the hypervisor is preparing to emulate it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7777` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
